Bill-
	One thing to keep in mind is that the=
 holdings of many temples were 
considerably larger back in the day, so it =
is entirely possible that it 
did run along the road south of the bridge at=
 one time. Sadly many 
great temples and shrines are reduced to just the ma=
in buildings on 
tracts just big enough to hold them...
-t

>  with th=
e map it would be more clear as to why I was confused. He

 the Byou-dou-in lies between Nara and the Uji bridge. Which is 
> true,

 but looking at the map you would think that it was located somewhere 
> al=
ong
>  the road running south from the bridge. Thats why the rest of his
> =
 description of the battle was hard to follow. You would never know 
> that=
 the
>  building was within view of the bridge.
